subject: Medicine
title: Paternalism vs Patient Choice
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Paternalism vs Patient Choice.

hook.text: A surgeon knows the best option is surgery. The patient refuses. Who decides what happens next?

buildup.text: Medical paternalism means the doctor decides what's best. Patient autonomy means the patient decides.

discovery.text: For centuries, doctors made all decisions. The shift to patient autonomy only happened in the late 20th century.

twist.text: Full autonomy can backfire: patients may refuse vaccines or choose unproven treatments based on misinformation.

climax.text: Modern ethics seeks shared decision-makingâ€”doctors inform, patients decide, both collaborate.

punchline.text: Good medicine is a conversation, not a command.

quiz.question: What is shared decision-making in medicine?
options: Doctors inform and patients decide through collaboration
Doctors make all medical decisions for the patient
Patients choose treatments without any medical guidance
